action.action-desc: Mr. Poe of Texas (for himself, Mr. Cohen, Mr. Ryan of Ohio, Mrs. Mimi Walters of California, Ms. Clark of Massachusetts, Ms. Kuster of New Hampshire, Mr. Rodney Davis of Illinois, and Mr. Moulton) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To extend the civil statute of limitations for victims of Federal sex offenses.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Extending Justice for Sex Crime Victims Act of 2017.

section.header: Extension of statute of limitations for civil remedy for personal injuries
section.text: Part I of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking the later of; and
in paragraph (1) by striking after the cause of action arose; or and inserting the following:

quoted-block.text: after the date upon which the plaintiff discovers the later of—

subparagraph.text: the violation that forms the basis for the claim; or
the injury that forms the basis for the claim; or

paragraph.text: in section 2255(b), by striking filed within 10 years and all that follows through the end and inserting the following:
not later than 10 years after the date upon which the plaintiff discovers the later of—

subparagraph.text: the violation that forms the basis for the claim; or
the injury that forms the basis for the claim; or

paragraph.text: in the case of a person under a legal disability, not later than 10 years after the disability ends.
